text.p: A diagram showing how the user interacts with application software on a typical desktop computer.The application software layer interfaces with the operating system, which in turn communicates with the hardware. The arrows indicate information Computer software, or simply software, is that part of a computer system that consists of encoded information or computer instructions, in contrast to the physical hardware from which the system is built.

ol.li: v. Engelhardt, Sebastian ([XX]). "The Economic Properties of Software". Jena Economic Research Papers.
Kaminsky, Dan. "Why Open Source Is The Optimum Economic Paradigm for Software".
